other_tests.findings: Initial lumbar puncture pressures were approximately 220 mmH2O, with final pressures around 90 mmH2O. Routine, biochemical, and cytological analyses of the CSF showed no significant abnormalities.

EEG examination showed asymmetry in the background activity of both brain regions, epileptic discharges in the left temporal region during interictal periods, and slow wave activity with medium amplitude starting in the left temporal region during ictal periods.
Two clinical seizure events were recorded; the patient exhibited unconscious autonomous activities in the right hand, followed by muscle tone disorders in the left upper limb.
